column4: hi all - i'm having trouble getting into gnome - problems with permissions on ~/.dmrc that i am unable to fix with chmod and problems locking ~/.ICEauthority - have tried chmodding and chowing but to no avail - can anyone help ?? ta :)
it didn't work, still get the .dmrc error where it wants 644 permissions and a locking problem with .ICEauthority
Do a reboot, then switch to tty1 and log in and rename them then?
renamed them from tty1 but will try a reboot just in case - thanks :) (possibly brb)
no joy - am ircing from tty1 as i speak... erm, type
Sorry, dont have any other ideas :( Renaming ICEauthority always solves those issues for me...
just to confirm should my homdir be chmodded to 644 or 755?
You need it to be 7xx regardless

are you still willing to help me? in the /xsession-errors file it says, after saying it can't create the Desktop, Documents etc folders in the home folder that it couldn't create the .gnome2 directory - is this revealing of anything?
Yeah, that you dont have appropriate rights :p
yeah, thought that might be the case, but chmod -R 700&& chown -R pete:pete don't do anything to help the situation
Do it the other way around... so you're sure you own the stuff before you chmod
yeah it did! thanks so much!!! it's the simple things that get by me with ubuntu - it's taking time to get used to ;)
Good thing it got solved then =)
